perturbation.original_text: Tickets agrees to pay MP3.com, during the term of this Agreement, as follows: (i) $[***] payable on the Effective Date; (ii) $[***] payable on or before one month subsequent to the Effective Date; (iii) $[***] payable on or before two months subsequent to the Effective Date; (iv) $[***] payable on or before three months subsequent to the Effective Date; (v) $[***] payable on or before four months subsequent to the Effective Date; (vi) $[***] payable on or before five months subsequent to the Effective Date. Any late payments under this Agreement will be assessed a service fee of one and one-half percent (1.5%) per month, to the extent allowed by law.
perturbation.changed_text: Tickets agrees to pay MP3.com, during the term of this Agreement, as follows: (i) $[***] payable on the Effective Date; (ii) $[***] payable on or before one month subsequent to the Effective Date; (iii) $[***] payable on or before two months subsequent to the Effective Date; (iv) $[***] payable on or before three months subsequent to the Effective Date; (v) $[***] payable on or before four months subsequent to the Effective Date; (vi) $[***] payable on or before five months subsequent to the Effective Date. Any late payments under this Agreement will be assessed a service fee of ten percent (10%) per month.
perturbation.explanation: California law restricts the maximum interest rate for consumer and some commercial transactions. Charging 10% per month (120% annually) may violate California usury laws if it exceeds the allowable rate.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Usury Law, California Constitution Article XV Section 1

perturbation.original_text: This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall remain in full force and effect until one (1) year subsequent to the Effective Date, provided however, that Tickets may terminate this Agreement for any reason upon thirty (30) days' notice to MP3. com at any time prior to the expiration of sixty (60) days subsequent to the Effective Date.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall remain in full force and effect until one (1) year subsequent to the Effective Date, provided however, that Tickets may terminate this Agreement for any reason upon five (5) days' notice to MP3. com at any time prior to the expiration of sixty (60) days subsequent to the Effective Date.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the termination notice period to 5 days is likely unreasonable and could be considered a breach of contract under California law, as it doesn't provide MP3.com with sufficient time to find a replacement sponsor or adjust their business operations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Contract Law - Implied Covenant of Good Faith and Fair Dealing

perturbation.original_text: Any claim arising out of or related to this Agreement must be brought exclusively in the state or federal courts located in San Diego County, California, and each party hereby consent to the jurisdiction thereof.
perturbation.changed_text: Any claim arising out of or related to this Agreement must be brought exclusively in the courts of MP3.com's choosing, regardless of jurisdiction or convenience, and each party hereby consents to the jurisdiction thereof.
perturbation.explanation: California law requires contracts to have a reasonable forum selection clause. Granting MP3.com the sole right to choose any court, regardless of its connection to the contract or convenience to Tickets.com, could be deemed unconscionable and unenforceable under California law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Code of Civil Procedure Section 410.30
